page.title: 04THE RICHMOND LAKE
page.content: Before the lake was here there was only farmland.It was excavated in 1922 by Redland GravelCompany to make concrete.For 30years it was used for gravel.For 20years after that it was a disused gravel pit.The hole filled naturally.In 1980 Mr.Kirk bought it and made it into a windsurfing and fishing centre. The fishing and windsurfing is becoming popular and there are over 200 visitors on a Sunday.Mr.Kirk infilled parts of the lake to make sure it is safe and also to make small pools for breeding fish.The lake is open for fishing from 6a.m.to 8p.m. The windsurfing centre provides a sailboard,wet suit and tuition for beginners.Further developments may include water skiing and aqua diving.
